description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ce1e5","text":"This protocol describes the steps to measure glucagon secretion in a static, 1-hour assay from isolated pancreatic islets. It is suitable for islets isolated from both rodents and humans. We routinely apply this protocol to assess alpha-cell function in response to low glucose concentrations and L-arginine but can be easily adapted to interrogate the response to a variety of secretagogues (eg. fatty acids, hormones). Briefly batches of 10 islets are pre-incubated in triplicate in KRB solution at 5.5 mM glucose twice for 20 min followed by incubation in 1 mM glucose with or without 10 mM L-arginine for 1 hour. Secreted glucagon is measured in the supernatant and intracellular glucagon content, after acid-alcohol extraction, by radioimmunoassay. This protocol is also suitable for assessing SST secretion, however we recommend increasing the islet number per well from 10 to at least 20 due to the relative lower levels of SST compared to glucagon.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: Free fatty acid receptor 4 inhibitory signaling in delta cells regulates islet hormone secretion in mice. Croze ML, Flisher MF, Guillaume A, Tremblay C, Noguchi GM, Granziera S, Vivot K, Castillo VC, Campbell SA, Ghislain J, Huising MO, Poitout V. Mol Metab. 2021 Mar;45:101166. doi: 10.1016/j.molmet.2021.101166. PMID: 33484949

{"blocks":[{"key":"fufbo","text":"Prepare KRB solution","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6661p","text":"Determine the number of static conditions for the assay in order to prepare a sufficient volume of KRB. Remember that you will have two pre-incubation steps and the picking, along with extra media to wash between these steps. In a beaker combine equal volumes of the four KRB stock solutions to achieve the desired volume. Add  HEPES powder and swirl to dissolve. Then add  BSA (fatty acid free), but do not mix as the BSA will stick to the sides. Cover with plastic wrap (put holes in top) and place in the   incubator for \u003e . Adjust the solution to  using   NaOH. {"blocks":[{"key":"46dsd","text":"Following isolation, the islets should be allowed to recover in recovery medium (RPMI / 10% serum /   glucose) for   at  . Wash the islets in a petri dish containing  of   Glucose in KRB.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":100,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":115,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":120,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":166,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":170,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6b68g","text":"Pick the islets (in triplicate batches of 10) into the islet picking plate wells.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ba89a","text":"Using a pipette transfer the islets from the picking plate to the first pre-incubation plate.
